title: Questions Are Raised About Vaccine Panel’s Reliability as Policy Review Gets Underway
summary: Senator Bill Cassidy warned against any new restrictions, and insurers suggested they would still cover routine vaccinations even if a C.D.C. panel tried to limit them.

title: Susan Monarez, Fired C.D.C. Director, to Testify About Her Clash With Kennedy
summary: At a Senate health committee hearing, Dr. Susan Monarez painted a picture of Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as a man wedded to his own ideology and uninterested in government scientists.

title: How Vaccines Are Revealing Cracks in Trump’s G.O.P.
summary: Some Republicans are starting to worry that the issue of health care could cost them politically.

title: Senator Says Meeting Between Kennedy and His C.D.C. Director Was Recorded, Then Backtracks
summary: The senator, Markwayne Mullin, quickly backtracked after pressing the now former director, Susan Monarez, on an exchange with the health secretary.

title: ABC Pulls Jimmy Kimmel Off Air for Charlie Kirk Comments After F.C.C. Pressure
summary: Mr. Kimmel faced criticism from the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission for remarks about the politics of the man who is accused of killing Mr. Kirk, the conservative activist.

title: Who Is Brendan Carr, the F.C.C. Chair Who Played a Role In Jimmy Kimmel’s Suspension?
summary: The chairman of the F.C.C., who is in the spotlight for his comments that may have led to the suspension of late night TV show host Jimmy Kimmel, has long criticized the media for perceived bias.

title: Reactions to ABC’s Pulling of ‘Kimmel’ Reflect America’s Partisan Divide
summary: Fans and liberals expressed anger while conservatives hailed ABC’s decision to pull Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night show off the air after comments about the killing of Charlie Kirk.

title: 3 Police Officers Are Killed in Shooting in Southern Pennsylvania
summary: Two other officers were injured in the shooting in York County, and the person who fired on the officers was also dead, officials said.

title: Behind Castle Walls, the Rich and Powerful Celebrate Trump
summary: The seating chart at the state dinner for President Trump was a cross-section of the rich and the powerful hoping to get on his good side.

title: Melania Trump, in Windsor, Takes Royal Refuge in Fashion
summary: A floor-length Burberry trench, an eye-obscuring hat and a yellow gown made quite a statement during the Trumps’ state visit to Britain.

title: Here’s Who Attended the State Dinner at Windsor Castle
summary: The guest list ranged from members of the royal family to titans of business and technology.

title: Windsor Castle’s State Dinner Features Lavish Menu
summary: Just over 100 staff members served 160 guests at the white-tie event.

title: Hong Kong’s Dim Sum Cart ‘Aunties’ Make Their Final Rounds
summary: Metropol, a massive banquet hall, is closing, and fading along with it is a cherished tradition of dim sum carts and the chatty women who push them.

title: Upending Precedent, Thune Bows To Realities of a Polarized Senate
summary: In using the nuclear option, John Thune has turned a Senate precedent on its head, defying his reputation as an institutionalist.

title: As Shutdown Looms, Democrats Outline Demands on Medicaid and Obamacare
summary: After rejecting a G.O.P.-written plan to keep federal funding flowing, Democrats released a counteroffer that would add more than $1 trillion in health spending.

title: Top Scientists Find Growing Evidence That Greenhouse Gases Are, in Fact, a Danger
summary: The assessment contradicts the Trump administration’s legal arguments for relaxing pollution rules.

title: Pig Organ Transplants May Pose a Dilemma for Some Jews and Muslims
summary: The taboo against pork is deeply entrenched in both religious traditions. But the prohibition is not absolute.

title: How China Is Losing Its Title as the World’s Sneaker Factory
summary: For American manufacturers, it is hard to quit China and its unrivaled factories. One industry is defying that reality as it shifts more production to Vietnam.

title: Giuliani Must Pay $1.3 Million to Former Lawyers, Judge Rules
summary: The ruling was just the latest misfortune to befall the former New York City mayor. He has been indicted and disbarred, filed for bankruptcy and suffered a fractured vertebra in a car crash.

title: John H. Luckadoo, Last Pilot from a Storied Bomber Group, Dies at 103
summary: As part of a unit known as the Bloody 100th, he flew 25 harrowing missions in his B-17 bomber over German-held territory during World War II.

title: In the West Bank, Trump Is Not Standing in Israel’s Way
summary: The Trump administration has not given its blessing to Israeli annexation of the West Bank. But it is doing little to stand in Israel’s way.

title: The Imperial Nostalgia of Donald Trump
summary: Both the United States and Britain are suffering through crises of identity.

title: Meta Unveils Smart Glasses With Apps and an Artificial Intelligence Assistant
summary: At its annual developer conference on Wednesday, Meta showed several new smart glasses, which have been a surprise hit for the company.

title: Remnants of Tropical Storm Mario Could Bring Heavy Rain to Southern California
summary: ‘There’s a lot that could happen and there’s a lot that could not happen at all,’ one meteorologist said of the complex forecast unfolding this week.

title: Ash Cloud Over Mount St. Helens Conjures Memories of 1980 Disaster
summary: A hazy cloud that emerged over the active volcano was the result of high winds rather than a new eruption.

title: Woman, 95, Charged With Killing 89-Year-Old Roommate in Nursing Home
summary: A witness found the suspect washing her hands in a room spattered with blood in a nursing home in Coney Island, Brooklyn, the authorities said.
